author: Special for USA TODAY
title: Don't miss these destination dumplings

locations.name: new york city’s lower east side

organizations.name: kings county imperial at nom wah nolita
galdones photography llc townsman's fried dumpling

text: Let friends in your social network know what you are reading about Facebook Email Don't miss these destination dumplings American restaurants serve all kinds of takes on Asian dumplings, from dim sum to dessert. Post to Facebook Don't miss these destination dumplings American restaurants serve all kinds of takes on Asian dumplings, from dim sum to dessert. Check out this story on USATODAY.com: http://usat.ly/2jXHCWl Cancel Send A link has been sent to your friend's email address. Posted! A link has been posted to your Facebook feed. Join the Nation's Conversation To find out more about Facebook commenting please read the Conversation Guidelines and FAQs Don't miss these destination dumplings Hilary Sheinbaum, Special for USA TODAY 6:58 a.m. ET Feb. 7, 2017 Facebook Posted! A link has been posted to your Facebook feed. Each year in Downtown Los Angeles, dumpling fans see how many they can consume in 10 minutes at the Day-Lee FoodsWorld Gyoza Eating Championship. The event goes through 4,200 chicken dumplings. Day-Lee Foods World Gyoza Eating Championship In Austin, Texas, Elizabeth Street Cafe offers bowls of pho, spring rolls and other Asian dishes. Henry Hargreaves Go for the Ginger-Chili Oil Dumplings with pork, shrimp, water chestnuts and herbs at Elizabeth Street Cafe. Henry Hargreaves Drunken Dumpling offers Manhattan’s largest soup dumpling, theXL Xiao Long Bao, only 50 of which are made a day. Josh Brusin Fullscreen The XL XLB is the size of a steamer bowl, made with homemade broth that combines chicken, pork, beef and seafood. To consume, patrons are instructed to poke one of the intricate folds of the XLB dough and drink the broth through a straw before eating the mixed filling and wrapper that keeps it all together. Josh Brusin In Chicago, Ramen-san’s menu is predominantly ramen, but a bao special was so popular, they keep bringing it back with different fillings. Ramen-san Ramen-san's Tang Bao is a giant meat or seafood-filled soup dumpling with a gelatin base. Ramen-san Try it with Berkshire pork and King crab. Ramen-san In Brooklyn, f.o.b. (short for “fresh off the boat”) serves Filipino fare with a barbecue focus. Ahmet Kiranbay f.o.b.'s Bola Bola Dumplings consists of ground beef meatballs, onion, garlic, pepper and fish sauce, served with calamansi juice and soy sauce. Ahmet Kiranbay At MilkWood in Louisville, chefs Edward Lee and Kevin Ashworth combine Asian and southern flavors and influences. Dan Dry Photography MilkWood's Xiao Long Bao contains oxtail, kimchi, benne seeds and scallion. courtesy of MilkWood A Lamb Neck and Kimchi Soup Dumpling also stands out on the rotating dim sum menu. courtesy of MilkWood At Pig & Khao on New York City’s Lower East Side, Philippine-inspired dumplings are available on the rotating tasting menu. Pig & Khao The Kare-Kare dumplings contain pan-seared braised oxtail in a coconut, peanut, shrimp paste sauce. Pig & Khao In Brooklyn, Kings County Imperial has a Shrimp and Pork Shumai with flying fish eggs from Russ & Daughters, a Jewish-Chinese mash-up. Levi Miller The classic shrimp and pork shumai is topped with salmon roe, tobiko and American paddlefish caviar. Kings County Imperial At Nom Wah Nolita in New York City, chef Calvin Eng recently introduced a bodega-inspired dumpling from an Adidas event collaboration. @onehungryjew The Triple C dumpling: Chinese Chopped Cheese is made with ground beef, American cheese, lettuce, tomato and steaze (translation: dope, dank) sauce, a tart, creamy mix with a Japanese kewpie mayo base. Nom Wah Nolita The buffet restaurant, Fresh Harvest, is near the casino and open to adults only for lunch and dinner. Daniel Newcomb Near Cleveland, Fresh Harvest at Hard Rock Rocksino Northfield Park serves Bacon Topped Apple Cherry Dumplings with apples and dried cherries inside, and caramel sauce and crispy bacon pieces on top. Hard Rock Rocksino Northfield Park In New York City, Tavo offers American cuisine with Japanese and Latin influences, with a popular dumpling dessert. Trillion Creative The Sweet Plantain Dumplings are made from roasted plantains and walnuts, served with a homemade cajeta-cognac dipping sauce. Trillion Creative 'Top Chef' alum Dale Talde set out to blend the ingredients, techniques and tastes of Eastern and Western cuisines at TALDE Miami Beach. Mark Ellin Here, Pretzel Pork & Chive Dumplings comprise ground pork fat, chives, salt, chicken powder, soy sauce, sesame oil, sugar and potato starch, served with spicy mustard. TALDE Miami Beach At Mintons in Harlem, Oxtail Dumplings represent different parts of the world: oxtail for the Caribbean, curry from India and dumpling wrappers inspired by China. Evan Sung Minton's Oxtail Dumplings are filled with braised oxtail and served on top of a green apple curry sauce with a taro root garnish. Liz Clayman In Las Vegas, Wuzuzu at Wynn Las Vegas makes 200 to 400 Jade Dumplings a day. Wynn Las Vegas Made with two types of flour, spinach, water chestnuts and shiitake mushroom, the vegan Jade Dumpling's dough is clear and slightly green. Jeff Green In D.C., China Chilcano combines Criollo, Chinese and Japanese influences in primarily Peruvian fare. Ken Wyner Thedim sum menu features Pegao Norteño, a lamb pot sticker with aderezo norteño (a northern dressing), crispy cumin lace and gold flakes. courtesy of China Chilcano At The Ritz-Carlton, Los Angeles, WP24 by Wolfgang Puck offers seasonal dumpling specials and a Chinese New Year menu. WP24 by Wolfgang Puck WP24's tasting menu features seasonal dumplings with fillings from king crab and squid ink to pork belly or chicken. WP24 by Wolfgang Puck In Boston, Townsman offers a rotating selection of pierogi-like dumplings, including some inspired by the restaurant's proximity to Chinatown. Galdones Photography LLC Townsman's Fried Dumpling is made with cultured cream and served with horseradish. courtesy of Townsman Fullscreen In Sherman Oaks, Calif., Boneyard Bistro offers Loaded Potato Potstickers made with mashed steamed potatoes, sour cream, cheddar and jack cheese, house cured and smoked bacon, and green onion. The dish is garnished with bacon and chives, and served with a side of French onion dip. Michele Gomez In West Hollywood, ROKU offers Lobster Gyoza Dumplings served with cilantro chili ponzu. courtesy of ROKU In Montclair, N.J., the new Ani Ramen House serves handmade crispy gyoza with pork, garlic and chives, alongside chili oil-soy sauce. dipping sauce Mike Marano At Foxwoods Resort & Casino in Mashantucket, Conn., High Rollers Luxury Lanes & Lounge serves Popcorn & Lobster Ragoons filled with cream cheese and lobster, tossed with popcorn, corn nuts and cotija cheese, and fried. High Rollers Luxury Lanes & Lounge In New York City's East Village, Carma East serves a variety of dim sum dumplings, from soup dumplings to "laughing dumplings" like these with vegetables. courtesy of Carma East Like this topic?
